revised_title: The Absence of Effect of Work Performance on Energy Liberated in a Muscle Twitch
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the energy liberated by a muscle during work performance. They discovered that the total energy in a muscle twitch remains the same whether work is done or not. This finding challenges previous theories about muscle contractions and thermodynamics, suggesting that a muscle behaves like a simple viscous-elastic body, with the mechanical work subtracted from the heat liberated in relaxation.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Muscle Physiology
